alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 08 at 12:25AM CDT until May 08 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR ABILENE... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Jones and Taylor. * WHEN...Until 115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1222 AM CDT,A line of strong to severe thunderstorms from Hodges...Tye and Dyess AFB will move east at 15 mph across Abilene. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Quick rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abilene, Wylie, Tye, Hawley, Dyess Afb, Caps, Potosi, Hamby, Impact, Kirby Lake and Lake Fort Phantom Hill. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 271 and 292. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Intersections along Sammons Street, Butternut Underpass, Curry Lane from Clack Street to Catclaw Drive, Texas Avenue at Arnold Boulevard, Intersections along Buttonwillow Parkway, South 27th Street at Catclaw Creek, FM 3308 crossing Draw, 2000 block of Oak Street, Broken Bough At Chimney Rock and Antilley Rd. crossing Button Willow Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
